conbody.p: T24 Basic IDE for TAFC provide the necessary tools to do T24 Basic local development with an editor for JBC code. Some of the features of this editor are context specific colouring, formatting, tooltip on keywords, code assist and hyper link to load source files.
It has several views which provide lists of CALLs, Inserts, Labels, TODOs, Regions etc., which help with navigation in the code.

It provides the necessary operations such as Compile code in server, list different directories from server and drag-and-drop files across local and server directories, and wizards to help in creating subroutines.

This chapter describes the BASIC (jBC) tooling available for TAFC. For the Java JVM-based T24 platform TAFJ, Eclipse tooling for BASIC (jBC) which is separate from what is described in this chapter is available, with more advanced features includes e.g. Java-like Eclipse Debugger integration. Documentation for the TAFJ BASIC (jBC) tooling is currently available in a separately distributed format.
